medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient has been feeling generally unwell since her colonoscopy 3 weeks ago. Over the past five days, she has become more fatigued and developed bloating and lower abdominal pain, more on the left side than the right. Pain intensity escalated over the past 3 days and is accompanied by nausea, without vomiting. The pain is described as dull, achy, sore, and constant. Denies bright red blood per rectum or melena.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mitral regurgitation (moderate to severe), diverticulosis, colon polyp, history of depression, insomnia.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of gastrointestinal malignancy or inflammatory bowel disease.
